channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15347] Update CHANGES.txt for 1.3
item.description: Going to post the steps in preparing changes file for 1.3 here.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.

comments.comment:
Seems like we have 5 jiras which appear in 1.2.1 but not in 1.3 (besides "meta" jiras like related to 1.2 release itself)

HBASE-14277
HBASE-14581
HBASE-14730
HBASE-14915
HBASE-15224
Forward-ported all 5 jiras above to branch-1 and branch-1.3.

Seems like we have 5 jiras which appear in 1.2.1 but not in 1.3 (besides "meta" jiras like related to 1.2 release itself)

Nice analysis. Did you use git logs or jira for the data?

Both, so far trying to follow the "Introduction to dark magic" published by Sean Busbey here HBASE-14025. I'd love to just use just jira, but doubt I can trust it much. So far trying to find the discrepancies.
doing the work to find corrections needed in jira is worth it, IMHO. over time we'll get better at keeping accurate track in JIRA, which I think is our only hope for keeping a good record.
All right, here're the release notes for 1.3

Restarting the work on release notes for 1.3. https://paste.apache.org/WuCo - initial list of things-in-git-but-not-in jira that I've cleaned up.

  • Some jiras committed then reverted are false-positives
  • some jiras with missed or incorrect fixVersion
  • bunch of jiras labeled against 1.3.1, whereas should be as 1.3.0

This step `comm -1 -3 CHANGES_1.3.0_git.txt CHANGES_1.3.0_jira.txt` (issues in jira but not in git) report 452 discrepancies in Jira

Looking through.

Sean Busbey FYI I've been looking through the changex.txt for 1.3 and find some data generated by Jira surprising. I"m looking why the above consistency check returned so many mismatches.

E.g. HBASE-10844 is added to auto-generated release notes in JIRA, though it's obvious that it was marked as "fixed" for 1.2.0 minor release?
(also cc stack just in case)

HBASE-10844 also has 1.3.0 listed as a fix version. Probably it was fixed after branch-1.2 was first created but before 1.2.0 happened. Some folks included "1.3.0" in the fix versions to note that they had remembered to push commits to both branch-1 and branch-1.2 during that time. While I went through and changed some of the tickets when cleaning up for 1.2.0, I must not have done it for all of them. Presuming you trust that everything marked 1.2.0 was also included in branch-1 you could bulk change them.

Sean Busbey yeah, I followed the discussion on the linked jira for CHANGES.txt for 1.2, and the consensus there seems to be that

  • we generally choose to make things easier / more obvious for committers at the cost of possibly a bit more work on RMs side
  • as such, fixVersions are set according to which branches the commit goes in at the time when the jira is resolved
  • during RC preparation, RM filters out jiras that marked for both 1.2.0 and 1.3.0 (or any other 2 consecutive minor x.x.0 releases).

Makes sense to me, I'm going to proceed with that.
Should we shove above list int he ref guide? I can do it. Any other things to add to the refguide RM session that come of your experience Mikhail Antonov?

stack yeah I think that would be useful, now these pieces seem to be scattered, though searchable. For now It doesn't seem to be anything super unexpected coming out of following the Sean Busbey's guidelines, and the thing with having to manually remove 1.2.0/1.3.0 entries from the notes makes sense.
updated CHANGES.txt for 1.3
committed changex.txt, removed -SNAPSHOT from poms and pushed RC tag.
updated asciidoc
